definition: to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: My Listent sinks dhave, tears surge away.
That even the setting stars will disappear at dawn.
sentences.chinese: 然而我們知道，即便是沉落之星，也將在黎明消失。

sentences.english: Her mass of kisses breaks and sinks.
sentences.chinese: 她的片片親吻破碎並沉落。

sentences.english: My heart sinks down, tears surge out.
My heart down, tears surge out.
Love is the never-setting sun in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 愛是天空中永不沉落的太陽。

sentences.english: Please have your eyes open to see the sunset sink.
sentences.chinese: 請擦亮眼睛，看夕陽的沉落。

sentences.english: My heart sinks down, tears surge out。
In the winter the sun sets early.

sentences.chinese: 神聖的靜寂和寬慰慢慢沉落。

definition: to vanish gradually/to disappear/to fade out
to float/to hover/also written 漂浮
spray/ocean spray/spindrift/fig. happenings from one's life/CL:朵[duo3]
to float/to hover/to drift (also fig., to lead a wandering life)/to rove/showy/superficial
